summary: This is an internal FBI email from Jennifer Maxwell, a Scarecrow Administrator, notifying users about a scheduled outage for the 'Scarecrow' web system for security updates on November 25, 2019. The document is part of the Epstein case files, suggesting the FBI's 'Scarecrow' system may have been involved in the investigation.

persons.name: Jennifer Maxwell
persons.context: Author of the email notifying FBI users about a scheduled outage for the 'Scarecrow' web system for mandatory security patches and updates.

events.title: Scarecrow Web System Outage
events.description: A scheduled outage for the FBI's 'Scarecrow' website for mandatory web security patches and updates, planned to last 1 hour and 15 minutes starting at 11:45 PM EST.

keyFacts: The FBI operated a system called 'Scarecrow' as of November 2019, used for secure website login, remote device control, live transmission, streaming, tracking, and evidentiary recording.
The email is an internal FBI communication regarding system maintenance, included in the Epstein case document release.
The system outage was planned to potentially disrupt live streaming and tracking link transmissions, but evidentiary recording on devices was to continue if already in progress.
The document indicates the FBI's technical infrastructure ('Scarecrow') was active during the Epstein investigation period.
